>>33740539
That period of time, you may experience yourself feeling an odd, faint sense of melancholy. Ypu may dwell about problems occurring in your life and any that might be cropping up in the project. The mood may get depressive at times, but in that particular span of a few weeks or so that you've selected, you may feel a distinct motivation to push through no matter what.

You may experience it like the bounce of a ball. You fall and hit the ground, but immediately rise back up and continue going upward and onward.

You must be naturally adept at problem-solving, perhaps surprisingly anal and detail-oriented. You should have an affinity for the use of metrics and data. My recommendation would be to keep close tabs on the metrics of the development of your project and have a good sense of what anomalies are so that you can quickly formulate plans to squash them when they arise.

Also don't neglect self-care. Keep your office space very fresh and envigorating. Think about investing in scented candles or incense, noise-cancelling headphones with ocean waves ambience, plenty of coffee and water, a comfortable seat, well-ventilated workspace, and regular food.

If you have teammates you may be liable to rubbing them the wrong way or getting cross with them about something or other. Keeping yuorself personally pleased will allow you to keep work frustrations and life frustrations completely separate and allow you to better judge whatever conflicts arise in the workplace for what they are. People can be overly sensitive so you need to be prepared to be an adult and show them where they're wrong, responsibly.

posts.sub: Ghost in house - What is it?
posts.com:
Hey /x/

I have a problem. I live in a house that is about 50 years old. When my family got it about 20 years ago the neighbors all said that there was a ghost of a woman that people would see upstairs, even though the house had been vacant for a couple years.

When we lived here when I was a kid, we would hear someone walking around upstairs even when no one was there. The people who rented this house from my family also reported seeing and hearing things that could not be explained upstairs.

Fast forward to 2021. I move in and start renovating the house. All of a sudden activity shoots through the fucking roof. Contractors seeing shadow people, contractors getting pushed by figures that aren't there. Contractors claiming to see tools move. You name it.

At one point I was with one contractor carrying insulation upstairs, when we both saw a tape mesure on the floor spinning around fast, and it just kept going on its own without losing momentum. He got scared and left. If he would have told me that without me seeing it I would not have believed him.

Still, even after securing the sub floors, self leveling the floors, and installing new quiet hard flooring, we still here distinct sounds of someone walking around upstairs when literally no one is there. Footsteps and all.

It's become more aggressive as time has gone on. We have tried praying, talking to it, ignoring it...etc. No luck. Is it really an old woman? Is it a demon? What the fuck is this? Anything would be appreciated. Love you /x/ stay strange.

posts.sub: Coming to terms with being an “other”
posts.com:
I don’t know where to go from here.

Honestly, I had some pretty traumatic stuff happen to me when I was a young adolescent, primarily connected to my parents.

This shut me down socially and emotionally until about the age of 22 where I finally started addressing it.

Up until that point I wasted away latching onto narratives of “oh the West is degenerate” and “I’m just a normal dude who is in a situation that a lot of lost men my age are in” and “I should have faith in Christ and shit because I know things will eventually work out”

Well, three years later, I’m 25, and I’ve realized that I’m an “other” - an outsider, the grinch, etc.

Coming to this realization totally evolved my spiritual life, because I no longer have any real motivation to latch onto any social narratives or any real socially imposed moral frameworks whatsoever. Those narratives and moral frameworks exist only for the community of humanity who derive their happiness from each other.

I however can only (literally) derive happiness from myself. But unfortunately a lot of my drive is dead now that I realize that there’s nothing to strive for really anymore. That includes even trying to accept the sensations of loneliness and sadness, because what’s the point I come to terms with that or not? I can’t even rely on just a deity anymore. While I did find a god that speaks to me, I realize that my sociability with that deity is quite limited because I project essential socially organized humanity onto that deity, and so I can’t really even connect with that deity with anything. So I can’t even really use god as a motive.

So where do I go from here?

I seriously wonder if this is what the LHP actually is and if I’ve been secretly walking it my whole life. Learning to find contentment alone with nobody else.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33737927
Your perceptions shape your reality anon and I'm afraid you've lost your connection with humanity. Finding contentment in loneliness is beneficial to spiritual growth but you shouldn't make it your corporeal existence.

And quite frankly my mind has been so changed that I really can’t even feel genuine human emotions anymore, so there’s very little incentive to try.

posts.com:
>>33737927
As you continue to heal you will learn more about emotions and how to experience them; it will not be something you discover outwardly but rather something that will come from within. Something that is different than what you normally feel. The numbness is practiced, and with intentional thought you can heal that pain, know it's origin, remove it from yourself. But it is not something that happens in immediacy. If you want to be a person, you need to go where people are. You need to learn how to become one of them; talk to them, understand them. Practice social nicety because it's what can get you to that place, where you can be a person. Kindness may seem to you like bullshit, but what it really is is just an unspoken respect that people have for one another. We all deal with the shitstains of life, but we have to work together to make the future better and ourselves better. If we stagnate we become nothing, but honestly it's more difficult to become nothing than to become something. Even when you are doing things that you normally do you are learning something, and if you're not you should respect yourself enough to appraoch challenges and seek them out. Find things that you can conquer and follow through. Become a person. It's as easy as just doing it, because it's what you already are. You have just been taught that being that isn't what you should do. Listen to yourself and have the courage to go find whatever it is life has in store for you. You made it this far. Isn't that good enough reason to try?
You can do anything. As long as there are people there you can do any activity you want. You just have to find out what things you like and pursue them. Through that you find like-minded people. And through like-minded people, friends.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33741634
>That’s very interesting. Would like to explore more on that.
Well I looked into a bit. There's this guy called Jason Slot who is big into mycology and fungal genomics. They compared genomes of mushrooms that produce psilocybin and looked at where they occured. Based on that, they made two conclusions.

1. The psilocybin in mushrooms came through a horizontal gene transfer. That means rather than inherited, as we do, the "idea" of producing psilocybin was communicated peer to peer.

2. Those magic mushrooms typically occur in places with high insect density. In these insects psilocybin seems to dampen hunger. So the theory is that they developed psilocybin to not get eaten.

I think all of this kind of ties into my idea. If we consider the act of the insect as aggression towards the mushroom, then it's virtually the same as
>The mushroom is essentially telling you that it wants to coexist.
I can't help but feel like the horizontal gene transfer has to do with this as well. As if the whole strategy is that if everything is peaceful, everyone wins. The mushroom softly whispering: "Hey, did you know that Psilocybin is Love and Peace? If you're a mushroom you should try producing it yourself."

>>33655186
The ancient Lyrans were titans, standing 20 to 30 feet tall, from a planet much greater in size than ours. They were white-skinned, with blond hair, usually had blue eyes, and had a life span of around 2,000 years.
They were a warlike race that had not only developed technically, but were quite advanced in the use of spiritual power. They moved their warlike forces around the galaxy and used their great power to take control of many thousands of lesser-developed races.

Over the years the Lyran blood line was mixed with other civilizations, creating many different colors and races which spread throughout the galaxy.

Just as their race was at its highest peak of advancement, a huge destructive comet that became known as the Destroyer Comet found its way into the Lyran family of planets, and two-thirds of their race were killed.
The last fly past by the Destroyer was in 1680. If this is correct, it is likely that it is the comet we know as "The Great Comet of 1680": The first ever comet discovered by telescope.

Along with the destruction, their technology was wiped out, and they were unable to continue to exercise control over the great empire they had built. The great Lyran Empire had degenerated back to one planet with no technology to speak of.
They were barely able to survive and were faced with the task of rebuilding a civilization which once dominated thousands of other worlds.

After thousands of years, the Lyrans restored their society and again became a dominant force in the Galaxy. Pleiadian history documents that he Lyrans went through a series of civilizations over a period of several millions of years. It was their pattern to rise to power, begin to fight among themselves, and then degenerate into a primitive society and start all over again. On some occasions their wars were so brutal that it took millions of years for them to recover from the primitive state left by the destruction.

posts.name: Anonymouse
posts.com:
>>33664746
It wasn't until 387,000 B.C. that the Lyrans once again had an effect on Earth. Another war had ravaged Lyra, and many of those on the losing side had fled for safety. They travelled through the cosmos and came to Earth as a place of sanctuary.
It was peaceful here; the local humans were primitive and offered no resistance to their high technology. It was decided they would stay and build a colony.

Back home in Lyra it was discovered that a large group had fled to Earth, and ships were dispatched to come after them. Upon arriving at Earth they were disgusted and appalled to find the conditions that prevailed here. The local Earth-humans were being used as slaves and were being mistreated badly. Many were being used in experiments where they were being mated with animals, while others were being disfigured, raped, or maimed.
The colony was an example of the darkest side of man. Living in degeneration and filth, it was decided to leave the colony on Earth, take away all of their technology, including their space ships, and leave the 144,207 Lyran soldiers to their own fate on Earth.

This colony died out after several thousand years, and the spirits of the Lyran soldiers that were left behind became part of the spirit world of Earth. The 144,207 degenerate Lyran soldiers would now be incarnating here along with the original inhabitants.

The effect they would have on Earth would forever steer it away from a normal evolution.

posts.name: Anonymouse
posts.com:
>>33664910
Lyran history continued to repeat itself for thousands of years until, after restoring themselves once again to a high level of technology; they built flight machines with beamdrives and once again moved out into the cosmos. Their leaders were great scientists with an understanding of spiritual power, so once again they began to conquer other races. Their leaders soon realized the unlimited powers of the spiritual forces and developed them until they became masters of these great forces, becoming known as an ISHWISH (IHWH), meaning "god" or "king of wisdom."
The great power of their spirit allowed them to live for thousands of years, and they ruled over countless civilizations.

The Ishwish leaders ruled with cruel power, and eventually the public started a civil uprising. The war lasted for almost four centuries, causing the death of more than 60% of the population and nearly destroying the three worlds of the Lyra system. It seemed that no one in the Lyra systems would escape this slaughter that raged 230,000 years ago.

An Ishwish named Asael could see the end coming and fled from the wars with 360,000 people in 183 great spaceships, capable of transporting over a thousand passengers each, and 250 small space reconnaissance ships that could carry a crew of three. This group of Lyrans wandered through space for many years until they came across a star system with 254 still young, blue suns. There were already a few colonized planets with primitive people living there, but they were no threat to the great Lyran technology. They landed and built their new society on three different planets around a star they called Taygeta.
Life was hard and difficult, and it took 300 years or their civilization to grow and adapt to their new environment.

Millions of Lyrans fled the great wars and settled in Orion, Hyades and the Pleiades.

posts.name: Anonymouse
posts.com:
>>33664930
After the new civilization developed, Asael commanded that they start to explore and conquer other worlds again, just as they had done in Lyra.
The powerful beamdrive ships sped out into open space and once main established a reign of tyranny over planets of less-developed beings and brought them under their control. It was during this time that they came into the system known as the Hesperides.

A young, underdeveloped form of human life was there and was quickly conquered and fell under Asael's ruler ship.
The Lyrans once again were exercising their power over others and beginning to force their rule throughout the galaxy. It seems that the forces of greed and power were inbred well into the Lyrans, considering that peace seemed to escape them time after time.
There had been millions of years of bloodshed and wars, and still they had not learned to get along peacefully with other races.

The Ancient Lyrians split off to Orion, Hyades, and the Pleiades and started new colonies.
The planets of the Pleiades soon flourished and spread out to Earth, Mars, Hesperides, and Milona.

Seventy years of conquering had diminished Asael's lust for power, and his life of bloodthirsty rule came to an end as the father of the Pleiades passed away. Control of the new race of the Pleiades fell to his daughter Pleja, an Ishrish, (the female form of an Ishwish) who, like her father, had the blood of a warrior.

Eager to build their great society even farther, the ordered the exploration ships to again seek out new worlds that could fall under her rule.
As the ships moved out into space once again to explore, they came across the trail of the Destroyer Comet which so many years ago had been the destructive force that had ended the Lyran Empire. Contained within the tail of the great comet, they discovered debris from the planets of ancient Lyra.

It was decided to follow the comet for awhile and study its path of violence.

posts.name: Anonymouse
posts.com:

This was the destructive force that had changed the history of Lyra and caused death on thousands of worlds, and now it had brought the warriors from the Pleiades into a small sun system and the home of a little planet called Earth.

To their surprise, they discovered a small group of uncivilized people living there. Some were brown-skinned and could be traced to the origin of life on Earth. Others were of mixed color, but most were white-skinned and had a Lyran spirit-form. The Pleiadians had stumbled onto a colony founded by their ancient Lyran ancestors who had degenerated into a primitive society. Awed by their discovery of human life and common ancestry, it was decided to colonize three different planets in the system and continue the family chain. News of their discovery was sent back to the home planets and apparently sparked an interest in Pleja, for she ordered a great migration to be undertaken. Within a very short time thousands of travelers from tie Pleiades came and created societies on Earth, Mars, and Milona.
Milona was a planet which existed beyond the orbit of Mars at that time.

It was only a few short years before a small war raged on Earth, and many of the scientists left to return to the Pleiades, leaving the three planets to grow on their own.

Pleja was unhappy with this and did not want her new colonies to be destroyed, so she dispatched a fleet to stop the war, and things calmed down again.

More precisely, here's how it works in a more fundamental level.

When you enjoy the present moment, you forget about your very own existence, your self awareness decreases. When you sleep without dreaming you forget about everything, your awareness is at state 0 so time is null.

When you're socially awkward and you go out in social environment time passes slowly because you become self aware of every of your actions, you exist manually. When you're comfortable time passes fast.

When you watch the clock you become aware of time, you literally become aware of the highest index for existence.

Retarded people usually perceive time faster

Monkey faster but can still get bored.

Crocodiles are way dumber so it seems they never get bored.

For plants life passes as fast as a heart beat.

Until time become null (or infinite) and you reach the state of non-consciousness, or non-living.
